meanings.sent1: The friendly poulters at the market always have fresh chicken.
meanings.sent2: The poulters set up their stalls early in the morning to sell their poultry.
meanings.sent3: The poulters joked that their chickens were such good friends, they should start a band.
meanings.sent4: The poulters' market was a bustling hub of clucking activity.
meanings.sent5: The poulters' colorful feathers added a vibrant touch to the market.

meanings.definition: Plural form of poult, meaning a young domestic fowl.
meanings.sent1: The farm had a group of poulters running around the yard.
meanings.sent2: The poulters were chirping happily in the coop.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous poulters played hide-and-seek among the haystacks.
meanings.sent4: The poulters' feathers glistened in the sunlight like tiny jewels.
meanings.sent5: The fluffy poulters followed their mother hen around the farmyard.
